permissions_alarms.message: Makes it possible to create, view and remove alarms.

permissions_activeTab.message: Gives temporary access to the tab on which browserActions or contextmenu items are clicked

permissions_background.message: Runs the extension in the background even while chrome is closed.

permissions_bookmarks.message: Makes it possible to create, edit, remove and view all your bookmarks.

permissions_browsingData.message: Makes it possible to remove any saved data on your browser at specified time allowing the user to delete any history, saved passwords, cookies, cache and basically anything that is not saved in incognito mode but is in regular mode. This is editable so it is possible to delete ONLY your history and not the rest for example. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/bookmarks)

permissions_clipboardRead.message: Allows reading of the users' clipboard

permissions_clipboardWrite.message: Allows writing data to the users' clipboard

permissions_cookies.message: Allows for the setting, getting and listening for changes of cookies on any website. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/cookies)

permissions_contentSettings.message: Allows changing or reading your browser settings to allow or deny things like javascript, plugins, popups, notifications or other things you can choose to accept or deny on a per-site basis. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/contentSettings)

permissions_contextMenus.message: Allows for the changing of the chrome contextmenu

permissions_declarativeContent.message: Allows for the running of scripts on pages based on their url and CSS contents. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/declarativeContent)

permissions_desktopCapture.message: Makes it possible to capture your screen, current tab or chrome window (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/desktopCapture)

permissions_downloads.message: Allows for the creating, pausing, searching and removing of downloads and listening for any downloads happening. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/downloads)

permissions_history.message: Makes it possible to read your history and remove/add specific urls. This can also be used to search your history and to see how many times you visited given website. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/history)

permissions_identity.message: Allows for the API to ask you to provide your (google) identity to the script using oauth2, allowing you to pull data from lots of google APIs: calendar, contacts, custom search, drive, gmail, google maps, google+, url shortener (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/identity)

permissions_idle.message: Allows a script to detect whether your pc is in a locked, idle or active state. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/idle)

permissions_management.message: Allows for a script to uninstall or get information about an extension you installed, this does not however give permission to install other extensions. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/management)

permissions_notifications.message: Allows for the creating of notifications. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/notifications)

permissions_pageCapture.message: Allows for the saving of any page in MHTML. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/pageCapture)

permissions_power.message: Allows for a script to keep either your screen or your system altogether from sleeping. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/power)

permissions_privacy.message: Allows for a script to query what privacy features are on/off, for example autoFill, password saving, the translation feature. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/privacy)

permissions_printerProvider.message: Allows for a script to capture your print jobs' content and the printer used. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/printerProvider)

permissions_sessions.message: Makes it possible for a script to get all recently closed pages and devices connected to sync, also allows it to re-open those closed pages. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/sessions)

permissions_systemcpu.message: Allows a script to get info about the CPU. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/system_cpu)

permissions_systemmemory.message: Allows a script to get info about the amount of RAM memory on your computer. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/system_memory)

permissions_systemstorage.message: Allows a script to get info about the amount of storage on your computer and be notified when external storage is attached or detached. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/system_storage)

permissions_topSites.message: Allows a script to your top sites, which are the sites on your new tab screen. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/topSites)

permissions_tabCapture.message: Allows the capturing of the CURRENT tab and only the tab. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/tabCapture)

permissions_tabs.message: Allows for the opening, closing and getting of tabs

permissions_tts.message: Allows a script to use chrome's text so speech engine. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/tts)

permissions_webNavigation.message: Allows a script info about newly created pages and allows it to get info about what website visit at that time. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/webNavigation)

permissions_webRequest.message: Allows a script info about newly created pages and allows it to get info about what website you are visiting, what resources are downloaded on the side, and can basically track the entire process of opening a new website. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/webRequest)

permissions_webRequestBlocking.message: Allows a script info about newly created pages and allows it to get info about what website you are visiting, what resources are downloaded on the side, and can basically track the entire process of opening a new website. This also allows the script to block certain requests for example for blocking ads or bad sites. (https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/webRequest)

permissions_crmGet.message: Allows the reading of your Custom Right-Click Menu, including names, contents of all nodes, what they do and some metadata for the nodes

permissions_crmWrite.message: Allows the writing of data and nodes to your Custom Right-Click Menu. This includes creating, copying and deleting nodes. Be very careful with this permission as it can be used to just copy nodes until your CRM is full and delete any nodes you had. It also allows changing current values in the CRM such as names, actual scripts in script-nodes etc.

permissions_crmRun.message: Allows the running of arbitrary scripts from the background-page

permissions_crmContextmenu.message: Allows the editing of this item's name in the contextmenu at runtime

permissions_chrome.message: Allows the use of chrome API's

permissions_browser.message: Allows the use of browser API's

permissions_GMAddStyle.message: Allows the adding of certain styles to the document through this API

permissions_GMDeleteValue.message: Allows the deletion of storage items

permissions_GMListValues.message: Allows the listing of all storage data

permissions_GMAddValueChangeListener.message: Allows for the listening of changes to the storage area

permissions_GMRemoveValueChangeListener.message: Allows for the removing of listeners

permissions_GMSetValue.message: Allows for the setting of storage data values

permissions_GMGetValue.message: Allows the reading of values from the storage

permissions_GMLog.message: Allows for the logging of values to the console (same as normal console.log)

permissions_GMGetResourceText.message: Allows the reading of the content of resources defined in the header

permissions_GMGetResourceURL.message: Allows the reading of the URL of the pre-declared resource

permissions_GMRegisterMenuCommand.message: Allows the adding of a button to the extension menu - not implemented

permissions_GMUnregisterMenuCommand.message: Allows the removing of an added button - not implemented

permissions_GMOpenInTab.message: Allows the opening of a tab with given URL

permissions_GMXmlhttpRequest.message: Allows you to make an XHR to any site you want

permissions_GMDownload.message: Allows the downloading of data to the hard disk

permissions_GMGetTab.message: Allows the reading of an object that's persistent while the tab is open - not implemented

permissions_GMSaveTab.message: Allows the saving of the tab object to reopen after a page unload - not implemented

permissions_GMGetTabs.message: Allows the reading of all tab object - not implemented

permissions_GMSetClipboard.message: Allows copying data to the clipboard - not implemented

permissions_GMInfo.message: Allows the reading of some script info

permissions_unsafeWindow.message: Allows the running on an unsafe window object - available by default

langs_selector_clickToChangeLanguage.message: Click here to change your language

langs_selector_requestLanguage.message: Request a language or consider translating into yours

crmApp_editor_settings_jslintGlobals.message: Comma separated list of JSLint globals

crmApp_header_oldChrome.message: You are using a very old version of Chrome ($VERSION$ years old). Some features may perform worse or not at all. Please consider updating your chrome

crmApp_crmtype_toggle.message: Toggle showing items that are visible when right-clicking on $CONTENTTYPE$

crmApp_options_catchErrors.message: Catch errors in scripts and log them. If off, allows for easier debugging using your browser's "pause on exceptions", if on, allows for custom handling.

crmApp_options_showoptions.message: Show options link in right-click menu

crmApp_options_recoverUnsavedData.message: Prompt you with an option to recover your unsaved script after you close a script/stylesheet without hitting the "save" or "exit" button.

crmApp_options_CRMOnPageDisabled.message: Can't disable demo contextmenu in demo mode

crmApp_options_CRMOnPageOption.message: Use your custom right-click menu on this page as a preview instead of your browser's regular one.

crmApp_options_chromeLow.message: Your chrome version is too low for this to be possible (min is chrome 34, you have $VERSION$)

crmApp_options_useStorageSyncDisabledUna.message: Syncing is not available in your browser

crmApp_options_useStorageSyncDisabledToo.message: Amount of data is too big to sync

crmApp_options_useStorageSyncOption.message: Sync your storage across all browser instances signed in to this account using browser storage sync. Turning this on will limit your total CRM size (including scripts, excluding libraries) to a total of 102,400 bytes. Currently using

crmApp_options_editCRMInRM.message: Edit the custom right-click Menu by clicking on the respective elements when right-clicking on this page

crmApp_defaultLinks_description.message: Here are some commonly used links to get you started. Click the "ADD" button to add the link to your custom right-click menu. It will be added at the end of the list but you can always change the order later if you want.

crmApp_searchEngines_description.message: These are some commonly used search-engines.Click "ADD" to add the search-engine to your CRM. You can then drag the link anywhere you want it to be. You can also change the name you want it to have below or do it when it's already in your CRM. The $REPLACE_VAL$ is replaced with whatever text you've selected (if any).

crmApp_uriScheme_description.message:
You may want to launch programs on your computer as well, instead of only using links.This is possible, but requires a bit of extra effort because of browsers' security restrictions.Directly linking to files on your computer to open them is not possible (at least not for executable programs),this is why you'll need to set up a custom (local only) URI that launches the program you want to launch.If you want to read up about it some more check out $CUSTOM_URI_INFO$ page.To make this possible you'll need to add a key/value pair in your registry. After doing this, instead of http:// use yourscheme:// as a link.
If you are on a mac you can use$CUSTOM_URI_MAC$method. If you are on a windows computer you can do this yourself if youwant to (follow $CUSTOM_URI_WINDOWS$ instructions),or you can generate a file you can download that will write the key/value pair for you by hitting the button below.The second method is a lot easier and faster but it's understandable if you don't trust this extension in which case you can do it manually.

crmApp_uriScheme_invalidScheme.message: This is not a valid scheme

crmApp_importing_description.message: Here you can import your settings or CRM nodes from somewhere else. Simply copy the code into the box below and hit "import". Checking "overwrite" will overwrite your current settings and/or CRM with the settings you imported.

crmApp_importing_error.message: Something went wrong processing the data, please check the data

crmApp_importing_overwriteTitle.message: Check this if you want to overwrite your CRM. If not checked, imported CRM is appended to the current one

crmApp_importing_legacyTitle.message: Check this if you're importing from the old version of the extension (pre-2016)

crmApp_exporting_description.message: Here you can export your settings and/or CRM. To export select CRM nodes hit the "select" button below the editor above and hit export. Paste the generated data into a different instance's "import" field to import the data.

crmApp_exporting_waiting.message: Waiting for text field... This may take some time

crmApp_help_description.message: If you need help with anything or you would simply like a step by step plan of how to do something, please checkout the $WIKI_LINK$. If you feel like there's a missing tutorial, please$CREATE_LINK$.

crmApp_contact_description.message: If you have found any bugs, thought of any suggestions or have any other reason to contact me you can do so at $SEND_EMAIL$. To find out more about me, check out $GITHUB$. You can also check out the github repository over $GITHUB_REPO$ if you want to report an issue, create a pull request, or just want to check out the code.I'm currently looking for beta testers for the extension.If you'd like to help by testing new releases and want to get new features early pleasesend me an email using the address above and I'll add you to the list.

crmApp_bugs_description.message: If you would like to report any bugs, you can do so by using the bug reporting tool.This is a screen overlay that will be visible when you toggle it. It is overlaidon top of every other dialog so you can always use it. To toggle it on/off usethe button below or hit $CTRL$ 3 times in a row quickly.

crmApp_globalExcludes_description.message: There are some sites on which you don't want any script to run on such as paypal and your bank's website, below you can enter these sites to make sure that no CRM script is ever ran on that page unless you specifically clicked on it. URLs must be specified as follows

crmApp_globalExcludes_patternInvalid.message: This is not a valid URL pattern!

crmApp_logging_description.message: Clicking on this button will take you to a page where you can monitor your scripts' logsfrom one central place. Think of it as a dev tools for all your scripts and withonly your logs. $BR$To make your logs show up there, use $CODE$ in your code.

crmApp_privacyPolicy_description.message: This extension does not store any personally identifiable information.This extension uses your browser's $DOCUMENTATION_LINK$ to sync your data across devices. This data only consists of your custom right-click menu and its settings.This means that these settings are stored on your browser manufacturer's servers.To turn off this feature, disable the "use storage sync" checkbox at the top of this page.

crmApp_toasts_contentType.message: You need to select at least one content type to show this node on, otherwise it will never be shown. To hide it change the triggers.

crmApp_toasts_storageExceeded.message: Storage sync has ran out of space, switched to local storage for the moment, remove CRM nodes or code and switch back to sync later

crmApp_toasts_acceptDownload.message: Please accept the permission request to report a bug or suggest a feature

crmApp_dialogs_codeSettings_noOptions.message: Looks like there's no options. Go to the options tab in the editor to make them.Also be sure to check whether no errors show up, if they do this won't work.

crmApp_dialogs_recoverUnsaved_descriptio.message: You closed an editing instance without saving or discarding it, are you sure you wanted to do this?

crmApp_dialogs_addLibrary_isThisOkay.message: Does this look okay to you?

crmApp_dialogs_cssEditorInfo_description.message: - Use $URL_REFERENCE$ to run certain CSS only on specified url for any code following this statement.Calling $URL_END$ will stop this from applying to the code below it.You can combine multiple $URL$ statements to run on multiple sites, so calling $URL_EXAMPLE_GOOGLE$ runs the code below on both sites.If for example you want any page's background-color to be black except for one website, you can use $URL$ to give that page a different background color.You can use regular expressions as long as you wrap them in brackets.$BR$ $BR$- Use the dev tools to find the CSS id/class of elements. Press F12 to open the dev tools, click the magnifying glass and click element you want to style.If you want only that element to be styled, right-click it in the developer tools and click "copy CSS path" and use that as the selector.If you want all elements with some class to be styled, simply use the class on it.

crmApp_dialogs_exporting_description.message: You can copy the data below and paste it in a different instance's "import" section to import those nodes. Enter an author's name below to export the nodes under that name. You can also leave it to "anonymous" to stay anonymous.

crmApp_dialogs_permissions_description.message: Here you can allow or disallow permissions for the current script, marked permissions are asked for in the script and will probably be needed for script execution. You should however be careful not to just turn on everything since that might enable malicious scripts to do bad things. Permissions starting with "GM_" are greasemonkey permissions, these can also be used if you want to also share this script with greasemonkey/tampermonkey users. You don't actually need to turn them on to use those APIs in this extension except the GM_download API and the GM_notification API since all the others are fairly harmless. However they will be required as metaTags if you run this script in greasemonkey/tampermonkey.

crmApp_dialogs_requestPermissions_descri.message: A script that you presumably wrote or added has asked to use one or more browser permissions that you have not yet allowed for this extension, please allow these permissions as you see fit.Remember that this will only allow YOU to write scripts that access these permissions and not downloaded and installed scripts.Other scripts can only access these permissions if you give those scripts specifically that permission on installing them.You can basically allow any permission, they will only be used if you write them into one of your own scripts (or a downloaded one requests it) so allowing permissions that are not used yet simply saves you the hassle of doing it later during script installation or execution.

crmApp_dialogs_addedPermissions_header.message: The script $NODENAME$has been updated to version $NODEVERSION$and some new permissions have been requested

crmApp_code_nodeUpdated.message: Node $NAME$ was updated from version $OLDVERSION to version $NEWVERSION

crmApp_code_extensionUpdated.message: Extension has been updated to version $VERSION$

crmApp_code_settingsUpdated.message: Settings were updated to those on $DATE$

crmApp_code_hiMessage.message: Hey there, if you're interested in how this extension works check out the github repository over at https://github.com/SanderRonde/CustomRightClickMenu

crmApp_code_consoleInfo.message: To get information about how to edit settings from the console call the window.consoleInfo() function

crmApp_code_permissionsNotSupported.message: Your browser does not support requesting permissions

crmApp_code_downloadNotSupported.message: Your browser does not support asking for the download permission

crmApp_code_alreadyEditingNode.message: Please close the current dialog first

background_init_loggingExplanation.message: If you're here to check out your background script, get its ID (you can type getID("name") to find the ID), and type filter(id, [optional tabId]) to show only those messages. You can also visit the logging page for even better logging over at $LOGGINGURL$

background_init_debugExplanation.message: You can also use the debugger for scripts by calling window.debugNextScriptCall(id) and window.debugBackgroundScript(id) for scripts and backgroundscripts respectively. You can get the id by using the getID("name") function.

background_init_debugInfo.message: For all of these arrays goes, close and re-expand them to "refresh" their contents

background_storages_syncUploadError.message: Error on uploading to storage.sync, uploading to storage.local instead

background_storages_checkingFirst.message: Checking if this is the first run

install_confirm_permissionInfo.message: Not accepting a permission might lead to scripts silently failing.You can re-enable them at any time by going to the options page, editingthe node and clicking the "manager permissions" button.

install_confirm_notAsking.message: Not asking for permission $PERMISSION$ as your browser does not support asking for permissions

logging_description.message: This page serves as a sort of devTools for specific instances of scripts on tabs.You can choose to view logs for all instances, specific nodes, specific tabs, or a combinationof both. You can access a specific instance's variables and get/set them just as you wouldin the chrome dev tools, to do this simply select an ID and a tab ID

logging_runningCodeNotPossible.message: Running code is not possible in the current context (select both an ID and a tab)

logging_somethingWentWrong.message: Something went wrong highlighting the tab

util_errorReportingTool_title.message: Reporting a bug or suggesting a feature

util_errorReportingTool_description.message: You can report a bug that happened or a feature you would like to see in this extension. If you want you can also highlight a section of the page and send it along. When clicking the submit button you will be taken to the github website where you can file an issue. All necessary files (the image and if you want to your settings) will be downloaded, after which you can drop them on the report issue page. For this to be possible you need to accept the downloads permission window that will pop up.

util_errorReportingTool_bugreportInfo.message: Your CRM and settings will be included in the report that will be publicly visible, if you do not wish this you can report a bug or suggest a feature by sending an email to $EMAIL$

options_crmEditPage_hasAllPermissions.message: This means it has access to all permissions without having to enable them

options_editCrm_empty.message: It seems like there is no right-click menu for this content type, try something else or add a new node!

options_tools_paperLibrariesSelector_lib.message: Try to refrain from using unnecessary libraries, libraries load on every single page and load sepaerately for all scripts. This can easily take 100ms for libraries like jQuery. For a jQuery alternative consider using crmAPI.$ or simply $ (without loading jQuery) which features the selector function only.

options_editPages_generic_invalidURLPatt.message: This is not a valid URL pattern!

options_editPages_metadata_version.message: The script version. This is used for the update check.

options_editPages_metadata_icon.message: The script's icon in low res

options_editPages_metadata_iconURL.message: The script's icon in low res

options_editPages_metadata_defaulticon.message: The script's icon in low res

options_editPages_metadata_updateURL.message: An update URL for the userscript

options_editPages_metadata_downloadURL.message: Defines the URL where the script will be downloaded from when an update was detected

options_editPages_metadata_supportURL.message: Defines the URL where the user can report issues and get personal support

options_editPages_metadata_include.message: The pages on which the script should run

options_editPages_metadata_match.message: The pages on which the script should run

options_editPages_metadata_exclude.message: Exclude URLs even if they are included by **@include** or **@match**

options_editPages_metadata_require.message: Points to a javascript file that is loaded and executed before the script itself

options_editPages_metadata_resource.message: The Preloads resources that can be accessed by `GM_getResourceURL` and `GM_getResourceText` by the script of this script

options_editPages_metadata_connect.message: Domains which are allowed to be retrieved by `GM_xmlhttpRequest`

options_editPages_metadata_runAt.message: The moment the script is injected (document-start, document-body, document-end, document-idle or document-menu)

options_editPages_metadata_noframes.message: Makes the script run on the main page but not in iframes

options_editPages_metadata_CRMContentTyp.message: The content types on which to run this script as a 6 items long boolean array (e.g. [true, false, true, false, true, false]) (CRM ONLY)

options_editPages_metadata_CRMLaunchMode.message: When to run this script. 0 = Run on clicking, 1 = always run, 2 = run on specified, 3 = show on specified, 4 = disabled. (CRM ONLY)

options_editPages_metadata_CRMStylesheet.message: Interpret this as a stylesheet (userstyle) instead of a script (userscript). (CRM ONLY)

options_editPages_metadata_CRMToggle.message: A boolean value (true/false) indicating whether to allow toggling this stylesheet on or off. Only used when @CRM_stylesheet is present. (CRM ONLY)

options_editPages_metadata_CRMDefaultOn.message: A boolean value (true/false) indicating whether this stylesheet is toggled on by default. Only used when @CRM_stylesheet and @CRM_toggle are present. (CRM ONLY)

options_editPages_metadata_CRMLibraries.message: An array containing stringified objects with a "url" and a "name" key, pointing to external libraries used in this script.

options_editPages_metadata_license.message: The license for this script. If none is supplied, it's under exclusive copyright by default

options_editPages_metadata_preprocessor.message: The css preprocessor to use, choose from 'less', 'stylus', 'uso' or 'default'. For more info check out https://github.com/openstyles/stylus/wiki/Usercss#preprocessor

options_editPages_metadata_var.message: A variable that can be changed by the user and is replaced when compiling the stylesheet

options_editPages_monaco_startTagUserscr.message: The start tag for a UserScript metadata block

options_editPages_monaco_endTagUserscrip.message: The end tag for a UserScript metadata block

options_editPages_monaco_startTagUsersty.message: The start tag for a UserStyle metadata block

options_editPages_monaco_endTagUserstyle.message: The end tag for a UserStyle metadata block

options_editPages_monaco_minValue.message: The minimum value of the number

options_editPages_monaco_maxValue.message: The maximum value of the number

options_editPages_monaco_defaultValue.message: The default value for this option

options_editPages_monaco_value.message: The value of this option (set to null to unset)

options_editPages_monaco_valueExpanded.message: The value of this option, changing it here will have the same effect as changing it in the options dialog

options_editPages_monaco_maxLength.message: The maximum length of the string

options_editPages_monaco_format.message: A regex format that the string has to follow

options_editPages_monaco_values.message: The possible values of this option

options_editPages_monaco_maxItems.message: The maximum number of array items

options_editPages_monaco_items.message: The type of items this array contains (number or string)

options_editPages_code_triggerInfo.message: For trigger mode "execute when visiting sides" urls need to match $EXECUTEPREHTML$the following pattern$POSTHTML$ and for trigger mode "show when visiting specified sites" they need to match $MATCHPREHTML$this pattern$POSTHTML$. Regular URLs without wildcards (*) will match just that URL.

options_editPages_code_backgroundInfo.message: The background page will always be running. It's possible to communicate with it using the $COMMAPI$. The scripts only share their permissions.

options_editPages_code_optionsInfo.message: Create a key and press Ctrl+Space for format hints in the option object. Check out $PREHTML$this page$POSTHTML$ to see the format of the options. Keep the $schema line to enable format hints on pressing Ctrl+Space

options_editPages_code_globals.message: Comma separated list of JSLint globals

options_editPages_stylesheet_toggleInfo.message: Non-togglable CSS is not in the right-click menu but always active instead.

options_editPages_stylesheet_optionsInfo.message: See $PRESTYLUSHTML$this page$POSTHTML$ for more info about code options (vars) and preprocessors and see $PREUSERCSSHTML$this section$POSTHTML$ for examples (ignore the @-moz-document part).

options_editPages_stylesheet_stylusInfo.message: Unfortunately there's no syntax highlighting support for Stylus (yet). The editor will use LESS syntax highlighting instead as it's somewhat close to Stylus.
